title: Same Sex Couples and the Impact of Legislative Changes
abstractText:
This research will examine the experience and perceived impact of recent legislative changes such as the Employment Equality (Sexual Orientation) Regulations (2003), the Civil Partnership Act (2004) and the Adoption and Children Act (2002) on the lives of members of same sex couples.

It will investigate the experience and impact of these legislative changes in terms of whether they are regarded as having reduced discrimination against and improved social inclusion among same sex couples; or whether, as couples take up their new rights under these pieces of legislation, they experience new forms of discrimination at institutional and/ or informal levels. It will also explore the effect of socio-legal recognition on the lived experience of same sex couples and the impact of such change on attitudes towards state involvement in their lives.

These issues will be investigated using in-depth interviews with 48 members of same sex couples. The sample will include both individuals who had registered their partnership or who intend to do so, and individuals who do not intend to register their partnership or who are undecided about doing so.
